actions.text: Reported to Senate from the Committee on Government Operations (without written report).

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 94-313.

official_title: Original resolution reported authorizing additional expenditures by the Committee on Government Operations.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 94-313) Authorizes additional expenditures of up to $2,308,000 by the Senate Committee on Government Operations for specified inquiries and investigations through February 29, 1976. Provides that of that amount, not to exceed $237,200 shall be available for a study or investigation of: (1) budget and accounting measures, other than appropriations; (2) reorganizations in the executive branch of the Government; (3) reports of the Comptroller General of the United States and recommendations deemed necessary or desirable in connection with such reports; (4) the operation of Government activities at all levels with a view to determining its economy and efficiency; (5) the effects of laws enacted to reorganize the legislative and executive branches of the Government; and (6) the intergovernmental relationships between the United States, municipalities, and international organizations. States that up to $1,113,000 shall be available for specified studies relating to the efficiency and economy operations of all branches of the Government, and criminal activity.

titles.title: Original resolution reported authorizing additional expenditures by the Committee on Government Operations.
